data.title: MARTIN SCORSESE
data.meta_description: Martin Scorsese is an acclaimed American filmmaker, producer, screenwriter, and actor, born on November 17, 1942, in New York City. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema.
data.text:
Martin Scorsese is an acclaimed American filmmaker, producer, screenwriter, and actor, born on November 17, 1942, in New York City. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema. Scorsese's work often explores themes such as Italian-American identity, crime, and the conflict between personal values and societal expectations.

Some of his most notable films include:

Taxi Driver (1976): A psychological thriller starring Robert De Niro as Travis Bickle, a mentally unstable Vietnam War veteran who becomes a taxi driver in New York City.

Raging Bull (1980): A biographical sports drama film depicting the life of Jake LaMotta, a middleweight boxer, and starring Robert De Niro in an Oscar-winning performance.

Goodfellas (1990): A crime film based on the true story of Henry Hill's life in the mob, featuring an ensemble cast including Ray Liotta, Robert De Niro, and Joe Pesci.

The Departed (2006): A crime thriller that won Scorsese the Academy Award for Best Director. The film stars Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, and Jack Nicholson.

The Wolf of Wall Street (2013): A black comedy crime film based on the memoir of Jordan Belfort, a stockbroker who engaged in corrupt activities on Wall Street. Leonardo DiCaprio starred in the lead role.

In addition to his directorial work, Scorsese has been a strong advocate for the preservation of film history and the importance of film as an art form. He has also been involved in numerous documentaries and has served as a mentor and inspiration for many aspiring filmmakers. Scorsese's influence on the world of cinema is significant, and his body of work has left a lasting impact on the industry.

Scorsese's films have been nominated for numerous awards both nationally and internationally, with an Academy Award win for The Departed. In 1991, he received the Golden Plate Award of the American Academy of Achievement. In 1997, Scorsese received the AFI Life Achievement Award. In 1998, the American Film Institute placed three Scorsese films on their list of the greatest American movies: Raging Bull at No. 24, Taxi Driver at No. 47, and Goodfellas at No. 94. For the tenth-anniversary edition of their list, Raging Bull was moved to No. 4, Taxi Driver was moved to No. 52, and Goodfellas was moved to No. 92. In 2001, the American Film Institute placed two Scorsese films on their list of the most "heart-pounding movies" in American cinema: Taxi Driver at No. 22 and Raging Bull at No. 51. At a ceremony in Paris, France, on January 5, 2005, Martin Scorsese was awarded the French Legion of Honor in recognition of his contribution to cinema. On February 8, 2006, at the 48th Annual Grammy Awards, Scorsese was awarded the Grammy Award for Best Long Form Music Video for No Direction Home.
